input_text:
Job Title: Senior Account Manager (Commercial Lines)

Location: Overland Park, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
What You’ll Do

Senior Account Managers at IMA are experts in commercial property and casualty insurance and serve as key teammates to contribute to the success of the company and our clients. Our real estate team is currently seeking an additional experienced associate. Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

Supports and demonstrates IMA’s core valuesValues and understands the importance of diversity, equity, and inclusion among all IMA associatesServes as the day-to-day contact for all client requests within a book of business (comprised of a mix of Mid-Market & Large/Complex accounts)With direction from the Account Executive, prepares (or delegates where applicable) all relevant renewal materials (Premium & Loss summary, exposures, coverage comparison, premium & rate, etc.)Owns meeting facilitation, client interactions, negotiations, technical analysis, and program design with minimal oversight from AESupports in winning new business & supports AE with new client onboardingDemonstrates ability to anticipate client problems and provide solutions proactivelyAnticipate client problems and provide solutions proactivelyUsing the client workbook, and under the direction of the Account Executive, creates the marketing submission, and manages ongoing negotiations with carriersReceives quotes, reviews for accuracy and desired coverages, terms, pricing from submission, generates and populates the proposal, and sends to Account Executive for completion/reviewReceives policies, sends instructions to the applicable COE, and keeps COE abreast of any changes that occur during negotiations with ability to process the policy if neededPerforms premium allocations, surplus lines template preparation, Certificate of Insurance request template preparation & master approval, on-demand certificates, basic contract reviews, policy endorsements, resolves coverage and premium discrepancy issues, and conducts audits on expired and/or non-renewed policiesAs needed, serves as a team lead, mentor, and/or manager for other Account Managers within the department. This includes ensuring quality control standards of the team are continually maintained and works with the Commercial Lines Leader regarding department strategies, needs, and performance


 You Should Have: 

5+ yrs. applicable insurance experience with specialty experience preferredAbility to work within AMS and maintain data completeness standardsPossesses strong organizational skillsAbility to work independently, and lead special project assignmentsDemonstrates ability to build underwriter and client relationshipsAbility to delegate to appropriate parties when necessaryExperience with MS Office products required (specifically PowerPoint, Outlook, Word, and Excel)Pursuing or interest in pursuing P&C insruance licenseHolds or is pursuing formal specialty designation [ARM, CPCU, Industry specific designation] preferredSome travel required depending on book of business and industryStrong communication skills both written and verbal


This Job Description is not a complete statement of all duties and responsibilities comprising this position.

The IMA Financial Group, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, The IMA Financial Group, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Compensation & Benefits

Being a part of IMA has its benefits. When you become part of the IMA family, you become eligible to take part in our valuable benefits and rewards package designed to benefit you, your family, and your life. Our plans are cost-effective, convenient and provide progressive ways for staying healthy, protecting loved ones, pursuing financial security and living a full and balanced life. This role is eligible for the following:

Annual Performance Bonus, Stock Purchase, Medical Plans, Prescription Drugs, Dental, Vision, Family Assistance Program, FSA, HSA, Pre-Tax Parking Plan, EcoPass, Monthly Parking Reimbursement, 401(k), Life/AD&D, Accident, Critical Illness, Long Term Care, Short-term Disability, Long-term Disability, Business Travel Accident, Identity Theft, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, Sabbatical, Gift Matching, Health Club Reimbursement, Personal and Professional Development.

 Why Join IMA? 

We’ve built a reputation for putting our associates first

What if we told you that you could be an integral part of an entrepreneurial, expanding company, develop lasting relationships, earn competitive benefits, plus claim part ownership? It’s this unique ownership business model that makes working at IMA so appealing.

We work in teams. We sell in teams. We win and prosper as a team

We provide support systems and resources that enable each of our associates to focus on what they do best. And as an independent company based in the Midwest, we’re big enough to write business all over the world and small enough to implement your ideas quickly.

We are recognized nationally as a leader in our industry.

2023 Inc. Magazine’s Best Workplaces

 2023 Denver Business Journal’s Best Places to Work  2022-2023 Connecticut Top Work Places  2020-2022 Business Insurance Magazine Best Places to Work in Insurance  2021-2023 Inc. 5000’s List of Fastest Growing Companies  2019-2022 Civic 50 Colorado Honoree Recognizing 50 Most Community-Minded Companies  2022-2023 Kansas City Business Journal’s Best Places to Work  2021-2023 Los Angeles Business Journal’s Best Places to Work 2021-2023 The Salt Lake City Tribune Top Work Places 2021-2022 Puget Sound Business Journal’s Washington’s Best Workplaces  2021-2022 Wichita Business Journal’s Best Places to Work, #1 in extra-large category  2021 Dallas Business Journal’s Best Places to Work  2021 Alaska Journal of Commerce’s Best Workplaces in Alaska  2021 Wichita Business Journal’s Fastest Growing Companies List

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior Account Manager (Commercial Lines)
output_json.summary: Expert in commercial property and casualty insurance, serving as a key teammate to contribute to the success of the company and clients.
job_responsibilities: Supports and demonstrates IMA’s core values
Serves as the day-to-day contact for all client requests
Owns meeting facilitation, client interactions, negotiations, technical analysis, and program design
Supports in winning new business and new client onboarding
Anticipates client problems and provides proactive solutions
Uses the client workbook to create marketing submissions and manage negotiations with carriers
Receives quotes, reviews accuracy and desired coverages, terms, pricing
Receives policies, sends instructions to COE, keeps COE abreast of changes
Processes premium allocations, prepares surplus lines templates, manages certificate requests
Conducts audits on expired and non-renewed policies
Serves as a team lead, mentor, or manager for other Account Managers

IMA is recognized nationally as a leader in its industry, including awards such as Inc. Magazine’s Best Workplaces, Denver Business Journal’s Best Places to Work, Connecticut Top Work Places, Business Insurance Magazine Best Places to Work in Insurance, and more.
